Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this well.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,suchas for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: STATISTIC TYPE: the kind of statistic that is measured, such as drilled footage,distance driven etc.
Column Comment.3: STATISTIC OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for each instance of a kindof statistic for a well drill period.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: CURRENCY CONVERSION: A number which, when multipled by the stored value,will re-create the original value in the original currency used. Used only when thestatistic is a cost, and it is necessary to convert to a common currency.
Column Comment.6: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.10: MINIMUM AND MAXIMUM VALUE: A value range for a drilling statistic, such as minand max bit speed, or rate of penetration.
Column Comment.13: MINIMUM AND MAXIMUM VALUE: A value range for a drilling statistic, such as minand max bit speed, or rate of penetration.
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: STATISTIC CODE: code attached to a particular kind of statistic, in cases where thevalue should be selected from a list of allowed values for a kind of statistic.
Column Comment.20: STATISTIC DATE: the date associated with the statistic, such as the last date that astatistic of this type was captured.
Column Comment.21: STATISTIC TIME: A time that is relevant for a particular statistic.
Column Comment.22: STATISTIC TIMEZONE: The timezone for the time.
Column Comment.23: STATISTIC VALUE: the value assigned to this statistic where the result is a number.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
